Skill_Experience: Job DescriptionTechnical Skills: Analytics and Modeling   Education  Strong educational background is preferred. PhD/ Masters degree in Data Science, Applied Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Operations Research or equivalent strongly preferred; MS/PhD in engineering with emphasis on applied statistics or statistical modeling or MS/PhD in Computer Science or other quantitative disciplines with emphasis in machine learning and database management in unstructured data environment (Hadoop) also considered. 	Statistical programming skills: At least two years experience applying scientific methods in the field of analytics using statistical and mathematical programming packages such as R, Python. Java, Perl, C/C++ or any other programming language is a plus.	Machine learning  Expertise in supervised and unsupervised learning using a variety of machine learning algorithms is a must. Candidate should have both theoretical and practical understanding of parametric and non-parametric classification and regression models. Experience analyzing and presenting complex data and proven problem	 solving abilities is desired.	Feature engineering and Time-Series data analysis  Candidate should showcase expertise in engineering new features to improve model prediction/inference. Experience with time-series data is highly desired.	Hadoop Platform  Experience with Hadoop, Spark, and cloud computing ecosystem/platform will be preferred. Experience with Hive, Pig, Scala and MapReduce is desired. Parallel computing experience with Spark is highly desired.	SQL Database/Coding  Candidate should be able to write and execute complex queries in SQL. 	Visualization software - Advanced skills with TIBCO Spotfire or other visualization platforms are desired.Non-Technical Skills:	Business acumen  It is expected that the candidate is able to develop strong business acumen and a solid understanding of the industry, in addition to identifying new ways the business should be leveraging its data. 	Communication skills  The data scientist we are looking for needs to clearly and fluently translate the technical findings to a non-technical team, such as the Marketing or Sales departments. Candidate must enable the business to make decisions by arming them with quantified insights, in addition to understanding the needs of their non-technical colleagues in order to wrangle the data appropriately. Job Responsibility Requirements: 	Proficient in using data analytics tools to perform queries and analyses and for defining and correlating data, and skilled at utilizing data visualization platforms to organize and present summarizations, predictive analysis, comparative analysis, dashboards and reporting.	Perform data mining and analytics to support ongoing continuous risk monitoring and risk assessments of operational data to recognize patterns and trends, investigate anomalies, and assess internal control environment. 	Help with the design and implementation of data governance processes; the assessment and remediation of data quality related issues; working with large and complex enterprise data models and large volumes of data. 	Utilize data analysis by leveraging various statistical techniques, and predictive modeling to drive and identify indicators of risk. 	Drive efficiency by automation of manual auditing processes.Please fill the require detailsYears of Exp :CTC:Exp CTC:Notice period :Present Location :Kindly forward your Updated CV in a word format ASAP at Shivani.Johri@falconhr.comWarm Regards,Shivani JFalcon HR Consulting Pvt Ltd022-71600669

Skills 
Facilitation -  Basic ability to pull a broad mix of people and related skill bases together for a common purpose and goal. It will often involve ability to influence because people on your team will very rarely report directly to you as a leader. Group dynamic techniques to have an individual or group work through a challenging issue,  probe for issues/ concerns and drive to consensus.
Modeling -  The ability to represent information following a defined standard,  using a combination of graphical and textual elements. The ability to choose the correct type of model for a particular set of information,  depending on the type of information to be communicated as well as the audience who will consume the information.
Requirements Analysis -  The ability to understand requirements and trace them back to business goals/ objectives. The ability to identify the relationships and interdependencies between requirements. The ability to prioritize requirements based on their relative value,  risk,  difficulty of implementation,  urgency,  likelihood of success,  regulatory compliance,  or other factors.
Requirements Elicitation -  The ability to discover and document requirements from stakeholders using a variety of different methods. The ability to select the appropriate technique(s) for a given situation,  depending on the business domain,  deliverables needed,  time allocated,  and the risk involved in the effort. 
Solution Assessment & Validation -  The ability to understand and assess proposed solutions in order to determine how closely they meet requirements and if they will deliver the desired business outcomes. The ability to understand the organization,  and its readiness,  to determine what is necessary to transition to the solution.
Solution Definition -  The ability to articulate what constitutes business success for a given initiative. Necessary elements in the definition include outlining the business reason the initiative is being undertaken,  guidelines that are in operation for the initiative,  the domain of the solution,  and any important context surrounding the effort (for example risks,  constraints,  assumptions,  etc.).
Organizational Awareness -  Understands and works in line with the organization s mission,  operations,  structure,  and goals; understands informal structures and processes of the organization; understands organization- level implications of his or her day- to- day decisions.
Relationship Management -  Creates relationships with new acquaintances quickly and confidently; works to build trust and partner with stakeholders; successfully manages both internal and external relationships (e.g.,  vendor relationships); is comfortable in a challenger role that,  at times,  requires building constructive tension in interactions.
 Education,  Licenses,  Certifications 
College,  university,  or equivalent degree in Information Technology,  Business or a related subject required.  Experience 
Intermediate level of relevant work experience required. 3- 5 years of experience.

Must have in depth knowledge of Oracle R12
Experience of working with hardware such as printer andmobile scanners required.
Manufacturing process knowledge required.
Performs and documents functional testing of application newreleases.
Monitor suppliers for adherence to company processes andstandards
Assists business and functional resources in the design ofefficient business processes that fully leverage technical solutions beingdelivered or developed.
Work with functional excellent groups to follow standards(Implementation & Training) and contribute towards building excellence andzero defects.
Works on small projects or as a team member on largerinformation technology projects typically under direction of a more seniorbusiness analysts.
Involved in defining project scopes and timeframes. 
Support the development of functional specifications forassigned application development or implementation projects.
Provides functional support for the assigned applications tobusiness units globally.
Identify and manage risks within area of responsibility, escalating when appropriate.
Propose automation,  and streamline business intelligence anddecision processes.

Key Job Requirements

Review deal registrations for end user customers in Asia Pacific;   Enable partner to register opportunities;   Support reporting requirement on registered pipeline status. Partner Deal Registration Processing for ASEAN Countries and India

Responsibilities will be as follows: 

  Pick up partner registrations for end user customers in ASEAN countries and India

Enable Partners to Register Opportunities

Responsibilities will be as follows: 

  Answer partner inquiries on how to register a deal 
  Deliver training via WebEx to walk partner through 
  Advocate policy,  process changes and system updates 
  Network with frequent registering partners 

Support Reporting Requirement on Registered Pipeline Status

Responsibilities will be as follows: 

  Leverage Sales Intelligence dashboard on pre- designed charts 
  Pull out raw data on partner deal registrations 
  Produce registered pipeline cadence to support A&C; program needs 
  Produce registered deals stagnant analysis to support pipeline progression 
  Produce dashboard reports to support A&C; management on performance indicator

Skill_Experience:
* About Oracle Cloud Operations 
Oracle Cloud Operations plays a critical role in delivering best-of-breed cloud software solutions to Oracle customers. Cloud Operations supports dozens of cloud products - from customer experience through human capital management to enterprise analytics - that generate 40 billion platform transactions every single day. Our team provides 24/7/365, follow-the-sun coverage while pushing the boundaries of what can be accomplished in the cloud. Keeping up with cloud computing means you will have great growth opportunities, working in our expanding computing environments and operations teams.
 About The Job 

Do you love analyzing and improving business processes, including systems related to cloud services? Do you have experience with standardizing processes? Do you have excellent communication skills and enjoy building relationships? In this role, you can be that vital link between our services and our business objectives. 
 What You'll Do 
 Drive operational excellence through process improvement and task automation.  

Act as a reference person for other teams in the standardization of processes.

Define and execute the use cases, test cases, and support internal end users during the implementation phase.

Raise bugs and work with different technical teams in analyzing and following up on the issues.

Perform audits on systems to ensure proper fulfillment of requests.
   What You Need to Have 
To get past step one, you need to have the following knowledge, skills, and experience:
Education and Work Experience
A bachelor's degree (or its international equivalent) is required.

2 years of related work experience.
  Technical Qualifications
 Ability to collect, organize, and display data in spreadsheet format. 
  Soft Skill Qualifications
High attention to detail.

Follow-through skills to get information from internal and third parties and have data errors or omissions corrected.

Relationship management.

Ability to keep cool under pressure.

Strong verbal and written communication skills, with excellent command of English.

Team player.

Problem solving skills.
   What The Perfect Candidate Will Have 
In addition to the knowledge, skills, and experience listed above, you will score some extra points if you also have:
 Experience with cloud products and cloud infrastructure. 

Experience with advanced Excel functions.

*
 The work days for this role will be Sunday -  Thursday. Hours will be standard day shift local time.



    Role: 

 As a member of the Global CustomerCommunications team,  your focus will be delivering timely,  system- criticalinformation to Oracle customers around the world. You will work withseveral Cloud Application teams,  parsing many types of systems data,  timestampedinformation,  and outage details into summary documents,  formatted specificallyfor consumption by customers,  while meeting strict SLA requirements. As a GCCteam member,  you will exhibit strong technical/ business analyst skills,  weavingoutput from Oracle engineering,  support and technical teams into cohesivedocumentation. 



   Duties andResponsibilities: 

  Required to review major incident documentationto understand customer outages

  Identifies and establishes trends basedon incident data 

  Collects information from multiplesystems,  teams,  and documents

  Authors customer ready publicationsbased on templates,  document type,  and system

  Participates in document review processwith team members

  Uses Oracle tools to publishinformation to the customer base

  Works closely with Oracle legal toensure documentation meets requirements

  Self- manages incidents/ documentsassigned to queue; determines priority of own queue items based on SLA, information needed,  and customer requirements

  Follows consistent processes whileworking with tools and systems to collect data and information

  Reviews the priority and categorizationof documentation

  Maintains and updates processdocumentation.

  Communicates issues to team; worksproblems to resolution



   Key SkillsEssential: 

  Bachelor's Degree in Computing, Business Systems,  Engineering or Sciences or 8 years equivalent workexperience.

  5 years' experience in CustomerCare/ Customer Service/ Experience

  Very strong English communicationskills,  both speaking and writing. 

  Experience with incident/ ticketmanagement tools (such as CRM)

  Strong attention to detail

  Proven analytical and problem- solvingabilities.

  Ability to effectively prioritize andexecute tasks in a high- pressure environment.

  Experience working in a team- oriented, collaborative environment.

  Proactive and able to drive ad- hoc andvirtual teams to problem resolution.

  High level of self- motivation.

  Great interpersonal skills.

  Microsoft Excel -  working and managingspreadsheets

  Versioning,  managing multiple instancesof a document or software



   Key SkillsDesirable: 

  Knowledge of Oracle Core Products:Databases,  Fusion Middleware,  Applications and all things Cloud.

  Experience with ProcessImprovement/ Process Management

  Experience of analytical and trendanalysis.

  Experience of Root Causes Analysis.

  Experience with RightNow CX or OracleService Cloud a strong plus

  Basic understanding of enterprisesystems built on databases,  middleware,  virtualization and UNIX or Linux.

Skill_Experience:
PTC team is designed to be the primary team working directly with our partners to assist in standard and non - standard channel deals. They are responsible for understanding and orchestrating Oracle's Channel workflow and deal processes ,  as well as being the direct link between our VADs ,  partners and the channel sales team. This team is an extremely valuable asset to the Channel organization to ensure a clear and concise linkage for pricing ,  contracts and bookings. 

Desired skills:

Time Zone: APAC 

Key Responsibilities: 

Provide Operational Support to help Field Sales and Channel manager to initiate deal approvals ,  draft Ordering Document working with Deal Management and Booking submission to Order management team.

Alliance Management: 

Serve as a liaison with other divisions such as Deal Management ,  Migration ,  Approvals ,  Partner Contracts ,  Business Practices ,  and Order management in an effort to ensure accurate and timely transaction processing.

Partner alliances ,  communication through calls and emails for structuring the sales deals will happen occasionally.

Business Practices: 

This team will connect and collaborate with different sales ,  legal and contracts LOB s to improve business efficiency ,  consistency ,  and compliance in support of the organization s financial and tactical business objectives

Provide management with economic impact and compliance issues surrounding key business decisions and / or deals. Drive implementation of new processes and procedures and educate the sales teams globally.

Desired Qualification: 

Any Bachelor s Degree /  Minimum of 2 to 3 years experience in managing backend /  middle office operations ,  Proficient at MS Office Suite.

Candidate Requirements: 

Excellent Verbal and Written Communication Skills. The candidate will be required to interact through calls and emails with virtual teams in APAC ,  EMEA ,  AMER and LAD.

Hands - on experience in MS Office and MSWord is mandatory. 

Willing to work in shifts since it is a global sales support team. Expect flexibility in terms of time and process changes.

Demonstrate Positive attitude and exhibit good team player mindset.
